attributes.frontmatter:
title: Tabs
page_preferences:
  - display_name: "Color"
    id: color
    options_source: primary_color_options

attributes.content: Tabs can contain other Markdoc tags, such as partials and conditional content. If you can use it on a page, you can use it in a tab.
Include the URLs for links used in tabs at the bottom of the file along with the other links used on the page, not inside the tab.
Usually there's a bit of text here to introduce the tabs, so this paragraph is just filler text.
Tabs can include partials, such as these two:
Links in Markdoc tabs behave the same as any other link on the page. There's no need to keep separate lists of links inside each tab. Example link:
. Tab 2 contains the second example link.
This is the content for Tab 2.
